item.title: LLMs as Judges: Using Large Language Models to Evaluate AI-Generated Text
item.description: A comprehensive guide to using Large Language Models as automated judges for evaluating AI-generated text. Learn how to implement pointwise, pairwise, and ensemble evaluation systems using Python and Ollama, with practical examples and best practices for achieving 80-85% agreement with human evaluators.

item.title: Building AI Agents from Scratch: Understanding the Core Components Behind the Magic
item.description: A hands-on deep dive into building AI agents from scratch to understand the core components (LLM + memory + tools + loops) that power autonomous systems, moving beyond frameworks to master the fundamentals

item.title: Transformers from Scratch: Implementing Attention Is All You Need
item.description: Beginner-to-intermediate guide to the Transformer with PyTorch code: attention, multi-head attention, positional encoding, and a minimal encoder.
